text: I know I can encode something for a URL parameter with the urlencode filter - is there a way to decode a blob? my use-case - I need to have a JSON blob in a query string, so it’s been URL encoded. any way to decode this in HUBL?
Looks like HubSpot handles urldecoding in the request_dict

I have an issue with the `groupby` filter on HubL. It says on the documentation that on the first loop, we can call on a string variable called `grouper` , or in simple terms, the title of that group.

I wasn’t expecting it to return an object formatted as a string. In my case, I was expecting something like ‘Developers’, but instead it returned this:
`{id=1, name='Developers', order=0}`

It’s important to note that it may look like an object, but this is definitely returned as a string. Any devs can help me with this?
